title: How should I go about dealing with creditors?
question: Feb. 2014, emergency surgery, stopped breathing 20min. resuscitated thought to be a vegetable. 3 weeks later I leave hospital. Medical bills even with insurance. Another surgery in Nov. same year. Following year 2015 yet another surgery. I was a pretty sharp person that made $100,000 a year, then this all happened. Now, I have creditors filing leins against my home. My debt is $15,444. The road back to here has taken all this time for me to get, well, better. I do not work do to frustration and headache issues. My MD would not help with disability claim. My house is owned by my Trust. I do not trust the debt relief co. So what would be a solution to stop this madness.
answers: I am sorry you have been through such an ordeal. Dealing with a debt relief company for a legal matter is insane. For legal matters, using anyone other than a licensed CA is almost a guarantee of trouble. To properly answer your questions and address your concerns, the best way to handle this is with an in person consultation with an experienced CA mortgage foreclosure defense attorney. Use AVVO's Find a Lawyer tool to select a qualified attorney. Good luck. THIS IS NOT LEGAL ADVICE! YOU NEED TO SPEAK TO AN ATTORNEY WHO IS LICENSED IN YOUR STATE FOR LEGAL ADVICE. This is merely suggestions for you to think about in discussing your situation with the local attorney.
